TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
I don't use Bobcat Soyuz, so I don't know Maybe they're custom-tailored to overcome the bug. Soyuz-style boosters from NP also could do Korolev cross before 0.24; now they can't, if your speed is lower than 750 m\s.

ALV and NovaPunch K1 also designed to go together, but they allow some degree of free use (especially the engines). I don't see why is (projected) Tantares-Soyuz (TLV?) parts can't be used on any other design. For example: strap NovaPunch or KW SRBs instead of Soyuz LRB. Or strap Soyuz boosters to a 5m KW or NP 1st stage.

IIRC Bobcat uses a custom plugin (BobcatUtils.dll) for custom separations and some other fancy launch things(don't quote me on this).

If you are not familiar with the Bobcat design Soyuz lift rocket, it is using inbuilt engines + fuel tank combo, has some specific size tanks. I think this is what captainradish is talking about mentioning a lack of modularity in that design (I.E. the diameters are not totally compatible with other things).

Edit: I google what Sharik meant. Very nice .

Beale, the Vostok didn't land on Earth with the cosmonaut inside. Rather, the cosmonaut was ejected from the capsule at 7 km and descended to Earth separately. Are you gonna do that with your Vostok? Maybe you could put the kerbonaut in a cylindrical capsule within the Vostok with a built in ejection motor and parachute?

I would like to see that but I imagine it's a bit too complicated. Plus, you can currently (sort-of) have the same thing happen with Vanguard tech: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/25305-0-25-Vanguard-Technologies-EVA-parachutes-23!-24!-25!-(Dec-30)

Maybe next you can build Lunokhod and Luna-17?
